Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Dispute_Type: Regulatory allocation dispute between commercial and recreational fishing sectors
Grounds_for_Claim: Minister's decision inconsistent with prior assurances and departmental advice, lack of compensation for commercial sector
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to challenge TAC reallocation
Legal_Framework: Administrative law, Fisheries Act, principles of reasonableness in judicial review
Evidence_Requirement: Demonstration that decision falls within range of reasonable outcomes
Decision_Outcome: Minister's TAC reallocation deemed reasonable despite inconsistencies
Institutional_Action: Reallocation of Total Allowable Catch (TAC) by the Minister
Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Ministerial discretion in balancing economic, environmental, and policy concerns
Evidence_Type: Policy documents, internal departmental advice, regulatory history
Individual_Status_or_Claim: Commercial fishermen asserting property-like interests in TAC allocation
Nature_of_Participation: Judicial review proceeding initiated by affected stakeholders
Temporal_Context: Contemporary fisheries management decision amid declining halibut stocks
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard under Canadian administrative law
Governing_Body: Minister of Fisheries and Oceans Canada
Complaint_Issues: Uncompensated reduction in commercial TAC share, disregard of departmental advice
Role_of_Person: Commercial fishers as applicants; Minister as decision-maker
State_Protection_Assessment: State upheld through lawful exercise of regulatory authority
Risk_Factor: Economic impact on commercial fishers, sustainability concerns
Credibility: High, based on official records and ministerial accountability
State_Protection_Adequacy: Adequate, as decision was legally defensible and reviewed by court
Risk_Nature: Regulatory and economic risk due to quota reallocation
Enforcement_Action: Implementation of revised TAC allocation without compensation mechanism
Perpetrator_Entity: Minister of Fisheries (as exercising discretionary authority)
Legal_Basis: Section of the Fisheries Act granting Minister authority over TAC allocation
Victim_Basis: Commercial fishers experiencing economic loss due to policy change
